pages.text: Eosaurichthys is a potentially dubious genus of Actinopterygian fish. Similar to the larger Saurichthys, Eosaurichthys is a long and slender predatory fish, characterized by a long snout full of conical teeth, a powerful body ending in a lunate tail and the caudal positioning of dorsal and anal fins to improve speed and stability in water. The genus is quite often treated as a subgenus of Saurichthys, making its validity in classification dubious to many authors, due to the similarity between the two.
